channel.title: Need help with cache downloader and jar maker
channel.description: whenever my cache is in the computer, the client is not running unless the cache is in the same folder as my .java and .classes then it will run. also with my jar maker i am making the jar signing it but then it is still not running any ideas?

item.title: Need help with cache downloader and jar maker
item.dc:creator: @Welliton_inc Welliton_inc
item.description:
@Welliton_inc wrote:

[quote=“malimt, post:3, topic:550948”]choose your directory as C:/ or Users.home
I prefer users…[/quote]

Using C:/ nowadays is not great due to an increasing number of Mac users as the years have gone by. Macs don’t have the C:/ directory.

This is why we all should be using “user.home” This is used to make your client load a cache from a universal directory, meaning one that will work on any operating system.

The OP may have figured this out already, but just incase he hasn’t, In signlink, replace your findcachedir method with this:

public static String findcachedir() { return System.getProperty("user.home")+"/YOUR CACHE NAME/"; }

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with cache downloader and jar maker

item.title: Need help with cache downloader and jar maker
item.dc:creator: @malimt malimt
item.description:
@malimt wrote:

Signlink.java and cachedownloader.java.
Zip and upload your cache files, upload them to dropbox, get the short link for the uploaded cache…
Then, make sure you have the right cache name in signlink and the right directory…
Then, you could either choose your directory as C:/ or Users.home
I prefer users…
Need anymore help, comment.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help with cache downloader and jar maker

item.title: Need help with cache downloader and jar maker
item.dc:creator: @Welliton_inc Welliton_inc
item.description:
@Welliton_inc wrote:

The reason why your client won’t run is because your client is trying to find the cache in the directory of where your client is located, you will need to change that in your signlink class to your desired location.
Regarding the .Jar, can you be a little more specific as to what the issue is?

Read full topic
